page.title: 04..... Agriculture
page.content: Rural Wales. (1976) the hill farmers' diet probably consisted of potatoes, oatmeal, bacon, butter and cheese. Some idea of what a farm in Trecastle had can be evaluated from the Auction in October 1870 of Carllwyn farm. For sale were 5 cows in calf,3 heifers in calf, 3 yearlings in calf (all Herefords), one steer, 65 ewes, 25 wethers, 2o lambs, 2 carthorses and 2 pigs. implements included a gambo, a plough, a harrow, a roller, dairying and brewing implements, 2 mows of oats, 3 mows of barley, 2 mows of wheat and 4 ricks of hay. (A mow was a stack). Camden House had a commanding view of the High Street. The Post Office is situated on the opposite side of the road to the Blackhorse Inn. The High Street goes down into a valley.
